objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Predator iOS Stealth Evolution
objects.description: Development of a new mechanism in Predator spyware to hide surveillance indicators (camera/microphone dots) on iOS 14 by hooking the SpringBoard process.

objects.content:
Sector: Civil Society, Journalism, Government

Modus operandi:
Kernel-level access to SpringBoard via HiddenDot::setupHook() to nullify SBSensorActivityDataProvider, preventing UI updates of recording indicators.

objects.name: CarGurus Data Breach
objects.description: Exfiltration and public leak of over 12 million user accounts from the CarGurus automotive marketplace following a failed extortion attempt.

objects.content:
Sector: Automotive Marketplace

Modus operandi:
Data exfiltration including PII and IP addresses, followed by public disclosure on leak forums.

objects.name: CVE-2025-49113
objects.description:
Critical PHP Object Deserialization vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail allowing remote code execution via the _from parameter.

Affected product: Roundcube Webmail

Affected vendor: Roundcube

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:roundcube:webmail:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-25253
objects.description:
Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in the OpenClaw AI framework, exploited in the 'ClawHavoc' campaign.

Affected product: OpenClaw (formerly MoltBot)

Affected vendor: OpenClaw Project

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:openclaw:openclaw:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-2441
objects.description:
Zero-day vulnerability in Google Chrome allowing code execution via malicious webpages.

Affected product: Chrome

Affected vendor: Google

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:google:chrome:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: University of Mississippi Medical Center (UMMC)
objects.description:
Significant ransomware attack forcing the closure of all statewide clinic locations and a transition to manual, paper-based workflows.

Sector: Healthcare

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / Russia-Ukraine conflict expansion via Belarus
objects.content:
Sector: Military, Critical Infrastructure

Theme: Russia-Ukraine conflict expansion via Belarus

Ukrainian hacktivists (Fenix) uncovered Russian drone control repeaters deployed in Belarus to strike Northern Ukraine. This led to new sanctions against the Belarusian regime.

Tags: cyberwar, drones, belarus, russia, ukraine

objects.name: AI-Augmented Mass Exploitation of FortiGate Management Interfaces
objects.description:
A Russian-speaking actor compromised over 600 FortiGate devices by using commercial AI (Claude) to develop tools for credential decryption, reconnaissance (ARXON), and lateral movement planning.

Analysis:
The campaign demonstrates a significant reduction in the skill barrier for high-volume attacks. The actor used AI to bridge technical gaps in coding and network analysis but lacked persistence against hardened environments.

Recommendations:
- Disable Internet access to FortiGate management interfaces.
- Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all administrative accounts.

objects.content: The threat landscape for February 2026 is characterized by the massive democratization of offensive cyber capabilities through Artificial Intelligence (AI). Recent campaigns against FortiGate devices and the OpenClaw framework demonstrate that commercial AI services are allowing low-skilled actors to execute large-scale, automated operations. Concurrently, high-end spyware such as Predator is evolving to better evade mobile detection by hijacking system-level indicators on iOS, while state-sponsored groups (APT28, Winter Vivern) continue to weaponize long-standing vulnerabilities in essential services like webmail (Roundcube).

objects.name: CTI Report (EN) - 2026-02-22
